channel.title: Restore Windows Xp Computer to
channel.description:
Does anyone know how to manually restore your computer so its like the same as when you bought it? My brothers computer currupted and won't even run on safe mode. I don't feel like calling Dell Support, and he lost his freaking CD.
I know there is another way, like when you first start your computer you hit ctrl or alt + f#
I forgot it though, somone at dell support showed it to me. Can anyone help please?

item.title: Restore Windows Xp Computer to
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“vraj82192, post:17, topic:74595”]Lol its all good.

(Im Indian, and even I have a hard time understanding them. (VRAJ <-- Indian name ::PPPPP )

But ya I just called dell.

It works now, I know why it happend too.

My brother everytime he got off the computer he wouldn’t properly turn it off and he would have like 15 things running and he’d just hold the power button until it shut off.

(he got in trouble when my dad found out :eek: Funny to watch too :D)[/quote]

Holding the power button never hurt my computer.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

blah bah7:

you should just call dell

Yeah, they have pretty good tech. support but their call centres are in India, I’m not being racist but it can sometimes be a bit hard to understand them.

Read full topic

item.title: Restore Windows Xp Computer to
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“The Wise Guy, post:12, topic:74595”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=109548.msg1093741#msg1093741 date=1175753454]

If the computer doesn’t start up you can’t open cmd promt.

Can you? Lol

and I know you don’t need the CD I’v done it before without it I just hit like alt or cltr + f# …

No, you need a windows xp disc to repair a windows partition. You can’t do it any other way.

“If the computer doesn’t start up you can’t open cmd promt.” Sometimes when your pc goes corrupt a CMD type screen pops up saying some shit like there’s an error and you can use that.
[/quote]

Correction, My pc corroupted and would not start, I didn’t have a CD, I got it restored from a command the pakard bell service gave me[/quote]

Yes, you could ALWAYS boot from a backup partition most pc manufacturers give, but you’ll find a lot of pc manufactures don’t offer a backup partition.

The Mentor:

Start your computer, F8 or F10 for the normal recovery thing.

He said he can’t use safemode.

Read full topic

item.title: Restore Windows Xp Computer to
item.dc:creator: @The_Mentor The Mentor
item.description:
@The_Mentor wrote:

Start your computer, F8 or F10 for the normal recovery thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Restore Windows Xp Computer to
item.dc:creator: @The_Wise_Guy .Kaboom
item.description:
@The_Wise_Guy wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:5, topic:74595”][quote author=vraj82192 link=topic=109548.msg1093728#msg1093728 date=1175753305]
If the computer doesn’t start up you can’t open cmd promt.

Can you? Lol

and I know you don’t need the CD I’v done it before without it I just hit like alt or cltr + f# …

[/quote]

No, you need a windows xp disc to repair a windows partition. You can’t do it any other way.

“If the computer doesn’t start up you can’t open cmd promt.” Sometimes when your pc goes corrupt a CMD type screen pops up saying some shit like there’s an error and you can use that.[/quote]

Correction, My pc corroupted and would not start, I didn’t have a CD, I got it restored from a command the pakard bell service gave me

Read full topic

item.title: Restore Windows Xp Computer to

item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

If he lost his cd, you should be able to get another copy cheaply. I did when my cd got scratched.

Read full topic

item.title: Restore Windows Xp Computer to
item.dc:creator: @dudeofthed dudeofthed
item.description:
@dudeofthed wrote:

My mum did this too. I think she went to device manager or something. I am not sure, because my previous computer (The one i am using now, but newer) had a massive virus and my mum rang up the toll free number for Microsoft Support. And they told her to reset the computer, she did not use the disk at all. There is some other way by going to device manager or something.

Try ringing your toll free number.

Always trying to help.
From,
Dudeofthed.

Read full topic

item.title: Restore Windows Xp Computer to
item.dc:creator: @serpento serpento
item.description:
@serpento wrote:

Put the CD inside the CD drive, reboot your computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Restore Windows Xp Computer to
item.dc:creator: @vraj82192 vraj82192
item.description:
@vraj82192 wrote:

I googled it.

All I found was what you said before with the cmd promt.

but I would try that if I get it to open.

I googled it again and found another person with even the same error code and everything, I think I know what the problem is but Im not going to risk taking the memory out and putting it back in (inside the computer) because I don’t want anything to break.

Ill try googling it again.

Read full topic

item.title: Restore Windows Xp Computer to
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“vraj82192, post:6, topic:74595”]Well see the driver wasn’t deleted.

It just didn’t start up.

It said harmful something something dected. Windows is going to shutdown.

Then it gave me the error code.

(hold on ill give you what it exactly says, it happend to my computer and I hit like ctrl + f# at the begging of startup, and it let me restart my computer to how it was the first time i got it)

Error: A problem has been dected, and windows has been shut down to prevent damage to widnows.

etc etc etc…

(It doesn’t let me open up cmd, go into safe mode, or anything)[/quote]

Try putting it into google then.

Read full topic

item.title: Restore Windows Xp Computer to
item.dc:creator: @vraj82192 vraj82192
item.description:
@vraj82192 wrote:

Well see the driver wasn’t deleted.

It just didn’t start up.

It said harmful something something dected. Windows is going to shutdown.

Then it gave me the error code.

(hold on ill give you what it exactly says, it happend to my computer and I hit like ctrl + f# at the begging of startup, and it let me restart my computer to how it was the first time i got it)

Error: A problem has been dected, and windows has been shut down to prevent damage to widnows.

etc etc etc…

(It doesn’t let me open up cmd, go into safe mode, or anything)

Read full topic

item.title: Restore Windows Xp Computer to
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“vraj82192, post:3, topic:74595”]If the computer doesn’t start up you can’t open cmd promt.

Can you? Lol

and I know you don’t need the CD I’v done it before without it I just hit like alt or cltr + f# …[/quote]

No, you need a windows xp disc to repair a windows partition. You can’t do it any other way.

“If the computer doesn’t start up you can’t open cmd promt.” Sometimes when your pc goes corrupt a CMD type screen pops up saying some shit like there’s an error and you can use that.

Read full topic

item.title: Restore Windows Xp Computer to
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

You NEED a CD. If it comes up with a command prompt or something, try running chkdsk. (Type chkdsk and enter).

Read full topic
